title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly stated at the beginning and end of the document.

extractions.description: The paper addresses the challenge of quantifying behavioral differences in continuous-time diffusion processes. It introduces two pseudometrics as solutions and characterizes them through real-valued modal logics, which serve as quantitative analogs to the logical characterization of bisimulation.

type.justification: The paper is focused on defining theoretical concepts such as pseudometrics for continuous-time processes and proving their properties mathematically.
type.quote: In this work, we aim at quantifying how differently processes behave. We present two pseudometrics for diffusion-like processes. These pseudometrics are fixpoints of two different functionals on the space of 1-bounded pseudometrics on the state space.

name.justification: The paper explores mathematical concepts applicable to continuous-time diffusion processes, a topic relevant to the theoretical aspects of deep learning.
name.quote: This work focuses on honest diffusions, continuous-time processes without loss of mass over time and with additional regularity conditions.

name.justification: The paper revolves around stochastic models, particularly continuous-time diffusion processes, and methods to quantify their behavior.
name.quote: We restrict our study to diffusions that do not lose mass over time and with additional regularity constraints.
